member.name: M:FreneticGameCore.BasicEngine`2.GetAnyByType``1
member.summary:
Gets any one property with a specific property type from any and all entities currently spawned.
This does not care for any order if multiple entities contain the property.
This works best when only one entity will ever have a certain property in an engine. For example, the main player, or a game controller.
Returns null if none found.
member.returns: One property that matches, or null.

member.name: M:FreneticGameCore.EntitySystem.EntityPhysicsProperty`2.ApplyForce(FreneticGameCore.Location)
member.summary: Applies a force directly to the physics entity's body. The force is assumed to be perfectly central to the entity. Note: this is a force, not a velocity. Mass is relevant. This will activate the entity.

member.name: M:FreneticGameCore.EntitySystem.EntityPhysicsProperty`2.ApplyForce(FreneticGameCore.Location,FreneticGameCore.Location)
member.summary: Applies a force directly to the physics entity's body, at a specified relative origin point. The origin is relevant to the body's centerpoint. The further you get from the centerpoint, the more spin and less linear motion will be applied. Note: this is a force, not a velocity. Mass is relevant. This will activate the entity.
member.param: Where to apply the force at.

member.name: T:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine
member.summary:
Handles internationalization of text (translation to other languages).
Text IDs are specified as arrays in the form: FileID, Key, Variables
Key is an FDS key using dots '.' to represent a subkey separator.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine.AUTO_DEFAULT
member.summary: Used for and .

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine.DefaultLanguage
member.summary:
The default language. If unset, will be 'en_us' (English).
This is chosen as the default as most developers speak English, and it is commonly considered a default global language.
It is not required to be kept at English, though any developer using FGE probably understands English (based off the fact that all main docs and code names are English).

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine.EnglishDocuments
member.summary: The default documents in English (or, in whatever language is set to). Considered the root-most document, should be the best-written document samples most likely to be updated by developers.

member.summary: All documents in the currently set language.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine.CurrentLanguage
member.summary: The currently set language.

member.name: M:FreneticGameCore.LanguageEngine.SetLanguage(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the language to use. If the language specified is unavailable, text will fall back to . Should be in Language ID code, eg "en_us", but must match file names more than anything.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkableProperty.UpdateImportance
member.summary:
How important it is to update this property.
This helps decide which order and what times to update a property with.
Properties approaching their are automatically considered higher priority.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkableProperty.MinimumUpdateDelay
member.summary: The smallest amount of time (in seconds) before an update may be sent.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkableProperty.MaximumUpdateDelay
member.summary:
The largest amount of time (in seconds) before an update MUST be sent.
0 or negative values indicate disabling of this feature.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkableProperty.NetChannel
member.summary:
The network channel to send this property on.
Must be a valid network channel ID (registered with the ): otherwise no data will be sent!

member.name: T:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkExistsActivator
member.summary:
Indicates that a bool-returning C# property is used to decide whether network existence transmission should be sent on any given network tick.
Network existence transmission is when the network tells a client that the property is present.

member.name: T:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkUpdateActivator
member.summary:
Indicates that a bool-returning C# property is used to decide whether network update transmission should be sent on any given network tick.
Network update transmission is when the network tells a client of the current state of a property (that the client is already aware of).

member.summary: An enumeration of times to network a value.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkTime.NEVER
member.summary: Never network the value.

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkTime.EXISTENCE
member.summary: Network the value during existence transmission. (Existence transmission generally include an update!)

member.name: F:FreneticGameCore.NetworkSystem.NetworkTime.UPDATE
member.summary: network the value during update transmission. (Will generally also run from existence transmission!)

member.name: M:FreneticGameCore.Files.DataWriter.WriteVarInt(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Writes a variable integer to the stream. This writes 1 byte at a time, where the final bit signifies whether another byte of data follows.
For example, if we assume (DATA) to be any combination of 7 bits (zero or one, repeated seven times. Then (DATA)0 is one full VarInt. Additionally, (DATA)1(DATA)0 is as well a single full VarInt. (DATA)1(DATA)1(DATA)1(DATA)0 is as well as singular complete VarInt.
This can theoretically continue on to infinity for massive integers, where every byte has its final bit as a 1, until the very last byte's last bit, which is always a 0.
The first bit is always 0 for positive numbers, and 1 for negative numbers. The remaining bits are as described above.
